page.title: 09ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: {1915 The children had no toys only a few books. They played out or talked to their mother or father who would tell them about his day and make them laugh. The church ran an annual social with a band and dances like the Valeta. It also ran a Christmas party. People did a turn at concerts. The children had work to do at home. {1925 The children had Sunday School trips in a horse and cart to East Knoyle and a Sunday School party. They would go for a picnic in the woods with their parents on Sunday but they would have to bring back wood to burn. {1945 They had radios and dances in the village hall. There wasn't much entertainment because a lot had gone to fight in the war.
